so let's look at these 10 fundamental rules for meditation and truly without applying these rules
being able to be liberated from the shackles of the Mind becomes terribly difficult so let's begin
the first rule is become totally aware of your psychological mood this simply means be aware
of your emotions because if we want to experience samadhi which is a form of intelligent ecstasy and
Bliss in meditation then we must first introspect deeply on ourself and what is happening within the
inner atmosphere of One's Own inner world and how we feel emotionally many people who meditate at
best only ever see their thoughts without giving Focus to how those thoughts are making them feel
and also to comprehend how every thought mental form or image is preceded or caused
by The Duality of emotions in our life the pendulum of emotions such as pain or pleasure
happiness or sadness like or dislike we had to reflect in daily life how our emotional states
determines specific repeated thoughts and thought patterns that we have in the screen
of the mind and creates these repeated psychological songs within ourselves
for example every time we are happy perhaps we begin to fantasize about certain nice things
and when we are sad we begin to have thoughts uh related to losing hope in life and feeling very
depressed Etc if this is difficult to understand the little practice that helped me in the
beginning of my own path was making sure I asked myself about seven times a day how am I feeling
and just don't reply to yourself don't label anything any emotions just breathe and feel it out
sense the emotions within you and any thoughts related to those emotions sometimes the emotions
felt caused certain thoughts or sometimes the thoughts are reacting to positive or negative
emotions okay so remember we're not looking to be happy in meditation but instead to achieve
Serenity Tranquility peace calm Stillness of the mind that's a much different state
to feeling happy happiness is just a surface level temporary emotion and actually happiness without
the foundation of Serenity is very unstable because it's part of this pendulum of emotions
but also remember that Serenity or samadhi is just one aspect of meditation and so the second rule is
Serene reflection this means to investigate the origin of every thought and emotion
so once there is awareness of One's Own inner mood an atmosphere detached from it all just
watching our inner World calmly as if it's on a movie theater screen we investigate and examine
or at least estimate about the origin causes or reasons behind every thought we are seeing in
the screen of the mind this is to become our own psychologist to self-inquire in an intuitive way
the motive behind each thought why is it really there every desire we feel every image that
we see inquiring into the question of for what reason have these forms entered my inner space
this is important to comprehend because are we just going around in life and just letting any
thought or emotion come inside without knowing the reason as to why it is there in the first place
if everyone had this ability to have the choice about what kind of thoughts and emotions they
had we would obviously have very little people on the planet with depression anxiety anger etc
etc because if we saw these thoughts and emotions coming in the first place and comprehended them we
would of course not allow them into our inner world now of course it's very easy to become
over analytical with this and start getting caught up in thinking well this is where the
other rules in this list start helping us and in reality it is actually a very intuitive practice
the third rule is Serene observation okay the second rule was Serene reflection meaning to
reflect and scrutinize a little about our thoughts and emotions and comprehend them but now we are
just talking about Serene reflection and this is very simple but also very powerful it means
to just serenely observe the mind to be in observation simply placing perfect attention
on all mental forms that appear on the screen of the mind your awareness should just perceive any
and all things in an equal manner I say this in a repetitive way because you can give this
instruction to anyone but they'll always come back to you with a question of how do I overcome this
thought what about this thought I just can't get over this emotion no simply just observe
be firm in your practice to observe this aspect isn't about scrutinizing anything here we are
simply letting our awareness be a calm and still flame and illuminate anything that appears in our
perception if we see images hear sounds we just give equal Serene attention to it all we are not
isolating our concentration on any one thought but simply allowing the light of awareness to
shine in all directions in all dark corners of the Mind this should be and it is effortless
it is not a doing because as soon as we think we are doing something like we have to make effort
to do it taking action in meditation then we get lost in the inner movements of the Mind instead
of just observing the mind it is pure observation this is very powerful and you can come to deep and
profound states of meditation with this if you understand this principle in practice this is
really the most powerful technique in meditation in order to acquire perfect concentration
all of the techniques out there whether it's visualization chanting mantras or if it involves
moving the body or something like that would be relatively shallow without deep understanding
of this aspect to have no preferences in our awareness no distinction between
perceived phenomena to just have non-reactionary non-judgmental totally impartial neutral awareness
of all phenomena that arises in the mind this is called non-exclusive meditation and it's very
powerful because if one is doing very specific visualization or only focusing on the breath
or chanting mantras their concentration is then isolated it is exclusive to only focusing on that
one thing for example if you see on the screen two exclusively concentrate on one thing is the
same as our awareness focusing in one line like a laser pointing forwards however if that is the
only basis or Foundation of our meditation it is not a very deep form of meditation imagine instead
if a laser could shine out in all directions in 360 Degrees that's what we want then if you
chant mantras you won't lose yourself too much in the mantras or let other thoughts intrude while
trying to concentrate on the Mantra so I hope you can see how non-exclusive meditation is the
foundation to perfect concentration practice and so what happens when we train our awareness in
this way simply watching all phenomena in the mind with pure awareness allowing everything to be as
well the Mind may be noisy yes but if you are patient the mind will exhaust itself this is
exactly the same as if our mind was a muddy glass of water when we come to meditation the glass is
full of dirt because it has been agitated it has not been Serene during the day it is simply just
morbid full of filthy unconscious thoughts and emotions and then when we use this kind
of non-exclusive meditation this concentration we simply sit in our being with pure awareness
pure Consciousness waiting patiently for all the Perceptions in the mind to pass and eventually
all of the dirt in the glass will fall to the bottom and clear water will begin to appear all
the dirt that was previously swimming around simply just got tired and exhausted and fell
this is why it is said meditation allows us to see reality because we may have thought we were seeing

agitated excited full of negative and positive emotions all of the time only then will the mud

now of course this is far more transcendental when experienced compared to this uh shoddy

more and more it is literally like dynamite this powerful but simple technique for concentration
the fourth rule of meditation is in every moment in your daily life hold a sense of contemplation
this means to always be serenely contemplating things in life which yes can be applied to the
outer world but more importantly to the happenings of the inner mind the inner worlds to be genuinely
curious and watchful of what kind of things are happening within our Inner Space and this sense of
contemplation is something we also have to develop when we are not informal practices of meditation
but simply wherever we are and whatever we're doing in every moment of our life whether we're
at work walking in a park talking to many people Etc this helps us to not get lost in our life it
helps us to remember ourselves and our consistent practice this is how we begin to also develop a
universal mind and how we begin to see spiritual truth in all aspects of life and how we understand
how our personal life itself is part of our spiritual path and we begin to understand what
our particular individual role in our school of life is and how all the events in our life
up to now all make sense when we comprehend and contemplate why we are here where we are right now
according to the Divine timing of our particular life and with that particular understanding
of our individual progress comes great and deep acceptance of where we are and we learn to Simply
tread our path step by step with a lot more joy and a lot more insight as to how to take the next
steps in our progress this is just one benefit of becoming a more contemplative person in life
and how we understand spirituality is universal and applies to everything so without this rule we
could just become one of those people who think that spirituality is just something separate to
everything else in life but it's not spiritual universal truth permeates everything even in
the most superficial or dark places or situations the fifth rule of meditation is assume a receptive
psychological State this means that the intellect must feel itself to be receptive think about what
that means think about when you meet people in the world and everyone is not really receptive
or aware of the things around them or what you are saying to them their mind is not passively
receptive because it is preoccupied with too much mind stuff it has to instead be passive
receptive perceptive so our mind whether in formal meditation or not should always be like
a still and Serene lake when we throw rocks all the time or in other words we throw thoughts into
the lake bubbles rise up and disturb the lake causing Ripples and inner turbulence causing
us to not see or perceive very clearly our aim in practice should be perfect Stillness of the Inner
Lake so that it may reflect towards a perfect understanding of reality in return the sixth
rule of meditation is continuity of purpose this means to develop to hold a sense of or integrate
tenacity diligence firmness and consistency in meditation and our spiritual practices in
general we need the sense or force of willpower to not think about practice but to actually do
it to perform it to become 100 practical this is so important because if we are fickle indecisive
not sure about meditation or having thoughts like why am I doing this what's the points this
is boring I'm just going to go and eat a pizza and watch some Netflix or something then we are
lacking firmness and don't confuse firmness with forcing oneself to do meditation we should never
force ourselves we should just be firm after we've decided what to do this simply means to
deeply contemplate and realize why we are walking this path and remember the choices as to why we
made the decision in the first place it means to find your own particular reasons as to why you are
practicing meditation and just simply comprehend those reasons and remember them and then just take
the firm decision to do it and stick with it because this impulse is coming from our
conscience our being right and if we don't follow it well it would lead to unhappiness obviously
and so without this sense of continuity of purpose it is impossible to achieve States these higher
and deeper states that we've been exploring of Serenity ecstasy samati Satori because we have
not yet learned upright reasoning to just fully let go of the mind we're still hanging on to it
just a little bit because of our fickleness and lack of decision it's like we are just in
a bit of an experimental phase of our meditation practice and that's fine if that's where you're
at okay but know that the time will come for you to make a deeper decision a deeper commitment to
your inner self to merge more profoundly with your innermost your innermost being the seventh rule of
meditation is attend group meditations ideally if you have a gnostic school or lumicial near you go
and visit it see if you resonate with the people if you do and everything is positive it will help
tenfold and of course if not group meditations can still help a lot in places like Buddhist
centers they usually host things like that but just keep in mind of course meditation should
primarily always be practiced alone in solitude in your own privacy and energy and at your own pace
but every now and then if you can find a group of like-minded people to encourage and help each
other in a positive way it is helpful especially in the beginning too but we should also go about
this wisely not just joining any old random meditation groups because we might not get on

the eighth rule of meditation is become intensely Vigilant of your own mind this includes but isn't
limited to all strenuous activities or agitating exercises or whatever we have to do during daily
life such as when we're at work doing chores around the house Etc no matter what we're
doing whether in meditation or not we must be vigilant from moment to moment of our own mind
like a lighthouse Tower shining in all directions always watching closely for what kind of thoughts
are coming and going this means to always be highly alert and Vigilant like a Watchman in
the time of War I was observing my cats earlier and if you've ever seen a cat looking intensely
with wide eyes at a group of birds that's the type of wakefulness and alertness that we want in our
mind to always be ready and seeing and perceiving every movement energetic psychological emotional
sexual any movement that happens within perceiving it from moment to moment just watch watch observe
observe observe you never know when a destructive thought or emotion could Lead You astray
the ninth rule of meditation is avoid external sense perceptions this means
we should meditate with the eyes closed and that we must also eliminate any perceptions to do with
distracting external senses so if you're trying to meditate but you feel uncomfortable then get more
comfortable first maybe some tight clothes are distracting you wear something more comfortable
perhaps there are loud sounds outside close your window now this is a bit of a Razor's Edge because
yes in the beginning we need to eliminate these things and make a comfortable and encouraging
meditative environment for ourselves the problem is the Mind itself always wants more and is never
satisfied so be careful with this particular rule the superior way to handle this is by total
detachment of the mind's preferences or compulsion to be distracted a good and strong meditator can
meditate anywhere whether it's in a busy office wearing a suit whether it's in the middle of a
crowd in a busy City or perhaps in a prison where there is lots of suffering whatever these are all
good places to meditate for the advanced type of practitioner so we eliminate these attachments to
sense perceptions we eliminate these annoyances these mental irritations simply by observing
them and not identifying with them and you will see with patience the mind will Tire itself out
and you can enter a much more deeper state of meditation anywhere no matter where you are and
eventually you will not be so bothered about what position your physical body is in or about what
kind of physical sensation you achieve or how you feel or or you know you might you'll you'll find
yourself just being able to smile even when your family is having a big argument in the
other room right so instead you will experience true Detachment and through that being strong in
that practice you will understand what it feels like to be absorbed fully into the inner senses
of the Consciousness through total letting go of the attachments to the physical external sense
perceptions of the world it is even said that some of the best meditators are able to maintain strong
and Serene meditation even if they have hot coals on their legs so you can reflect on that in terms
of this attachment to the physical senses and with this knowledge we also have to understand
that guided meditations are just not very deep meditations because as long as you're listening
to something external through the physical senses then in a concentration is lacking of course in
the beginning guided meditations are fine they can help us a little bit and the same if you listen
to music while you're meditating okay fine but understand that it will not lead you to the type
of profound meditative states that we are talking about here eventually you must go beyond relying

take the plunge into the Inner Space of the innermost being and experience something much

body and the wise combination of meditation and sleep so this means that all the muscles
in the physical body should not be tense that we dedicate some time before meditation before
any of the more formal concentration practices to just bring awareness to the body and its muscles

in how there exists physical tensions that may arise when certain thoughts appear in the mind
too so there are these psychophysiological tensions that we can reflect on so we can
